modules.description: Provides functions to decode audio data from a stream using callback-based I/O, with support for reading, seeking, and tracking the current position. Works with audio streams encoded in Vorbis format, offering methods to extract PCM samples as floats or integers, manage bitstream metadata, and retrieve audio properties like duration and bitrate. Used for processing audio files or streams in real-time applications, such as audio playback or analysis tools.

Encodes PCM audio data into Ogg format using fixed or variable bitrate settings, supporting both float arrays and Bigarrays for input. It handles header encoding, stream synchronization, and time conversion based on granule positions. Used for real-time audio streaming and multiplexing multiple Ogg streams with precise timing control.

Initializes with the first three Ogg packets of a logical stream and validates packets for Vorbis data. Extracts Vorbis metadata and comments, and decodes PCM audio data into arrays or bigarrays. Used to process Ogg-Vorbis streams by parsing and reconstructing audio samples.

reads and processes Vorbis audio streams using callback-based I/O, supporting seek operations and position tracking; it handles PCM sample extraction in float or integer formats, metadata management, and audio property retrieval like duration and bitrate; it enables real-time audio processing tasks such as playback, analysis, or streaming; examples include extracting audio samples for visualization or modifying bitstream metadata during playback.

Generates a vorbis fisbone packet with specified serial number, sample rate, and optional start granule and headers, tailored for Ogg skeleton streams. Operates on integers, native integers, and string tuples to construct Ogg packets. Used to initialize audio streams in Ogg containers with metadata and timing information.

Provides functions for encoding and decoding audio streams using the Ogg, Vorbis, and Theora formats. Works with raw byte buffers, audio samples, and encoded packet structures. Enables integration of multimedia processing in applications requiring efficient compression and playback.

Encodes and decodes PCM audio between Ogg Vorbis format and arrays or bigarrays, handling headers, synchronization, and timing via granule positions. Extracts metadata, comments, and audio properties, while supporting real-time processing, seeking, and stream multiplexing. Processes Ogg-Vorbis streams with callback I/O, enabling tasks like visualization or metadata modification during playback. Constructs Ogg packets with custom serial numbers and timing information for use in Ogg skeleton streams.

Registers the Vorbis decoder with the Ogg demuxer, enabling playback of Vorbis audio streams. It processes Ogg packets and decodes them into raw audio data. The module interacts with the Ogg_demuxer to handle audio stream parsing and decoding.
